sub_fields.title: Describe what makes your idea innovative compared to what has been previously launched in the market (whether by you or others).
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
Liquidation market is an infrastructural protocol that provides automated and efficient liquidation execution for lending, borrowing, derivatives, and leverage trading platforms in decentralized finance (DeFi). Instead of each protocol building its own liquidation logic, Liquidation Market or LaaS offers a plug-and-play module that continuously monitors user positions, detects undercollateralized positions, and executes liquidations reliably, securely, and with optimal capital efficiency.

In essence, LaaS is a liquidation engine-for-hire that other DeFi platforms integrate to offload risk management.

sub_fields.title: Describe what your prototype or MVP will demonstrate, and where it can be accessed.
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
**How Liquidation\-as\-a\-Service Works \(Top\-Level\)**



**High\-Level Flow:**

1. User opens a leveraged/borrow position on Protocol A
2. Protocol A integrates LaaS via a liquidation adapter contract
3. LaaS continuously monitors user risk
4. When HF < 1, LaaS triggers liquidation
5. Liquidator bot or liquidity pool pays off debt
6. Collateral+premium is seized and redistributed to LaaS liquidity providers.
7. Protocol A remains solvent



**What the product \(LaaS\) Provides**

continuously tracks:

- Collateral and debt values
- Oracle price feeds
- Volatility and price deviations
- Health factor of every position



It uses off-chain indexers or on-chain notifiers to detect risks faster than traditional on-chain

bots.



**Automated Liquidation Execution**

Once a position becomes unsafe in any integrated defi protocol, our liquidator bot:

1. Verifies oracle prices and risk parameters
2. Calculates liquidation amount
3. Executes the liquidation transaction
4. Collects incentives (bonuses, penalties)
5. Repays debt on behalf of the protocol



The system ensures fast execution even during high congestion or volatility.



**LaaS can support:**

- Lending protocols
- Stablecoin platforms
- Leverage protocols
- Perp DEXes
- Options vaults

And many other CDP based protocols that are liquidatable



It becomes a standardized liquidation back-end for multiple DeFi products across the

ecosystem. So users don’t have to deploy capital in different protocols but deploy a single

capital in a single platform but earn liquidation premiums/bonuses across multiple protocols.

sub_fields.title: Describe realistic measures of success, ideally with on-chain metrics.
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
**Realistic Measures of Success for Liquidation Market**



Success for LaaS can be measured by protocol adoption, operational efficiency, and ecosystem impact using a small set of on-chain metrics.



**Key Metrics**



1. Protocol Adoption



- Number of DeFi platforms integrated with LaaS
- Total value of positions under monitoring (TVL)



2. Operational Efficiency



- Number of successful liquidations executed
- Average liquidation execution time from Health Factor <1



3. Liquidity Provider Performance



- Total capital deployed in LaaS liquidity pools
- Average liquidation rewards distributed to liquidity providers



4. Risk Mitigation



- Number or percentage of positions liquidated before going into bad debt
- Protocol solvency preserved for integrated platforms



These metrics provide transparent, verifiable proof of LaaS effectiveness while keeping tracking manageable. They focus on adoption, efficiency, capital utilization, and risk reduction, capturing the core value delivered by the protocol.

sub_fields.title: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.description: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.answer:
The proposed solution is Liquidation Market (LaaS), a plug-and-play, infrastructure-level liquidation engine for DeFi protocols. LaaS continuously monitors user positions across multiple integrated platforms, tracks collateral and debt values, observes oracle prices, and calculates health factors in real time. When a position becomes undercollateralized, LaaS automatically executes the liquidation, repays the debt, and distributes the seized collateral and liquidation premium to liquidity providers.



This solution directly addresses the problem in several ways:



**Unified and Standardized Liquidation System:** By serving multiple protocols through a single backend, LaaS eliminates fragmented liquidation infrastructure.



**Faster and Reliable Execution:** Continuous monitoring and automated liquidations ensure positions are closed before they become bad debt, even during periods of high network congestion or market volatility.



**Capital Efficiency and Liquidity Optimization:** Liquidity providers can participate once and earn liquidation premiums across multiple protocols, improving capital deployment and reducing the need for separate liquidity in each platform.



**Reduced Protocol Risk:** By outsourcing liquidation to a reliable, monitored system, integrated protocols can maintain solvency and focus on product development rather than building and maintaining their own liquidation engines.

sub_fields.title: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.description: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.answer:
Liquidation Market (LaaS) will provide a reliable, standardized, and automated liquidation infrastructure for DeFi protocols built on Cardano. By offering a shared backend for lending platforms, stablecoins, leverage trading, and derivatives protocols, LaaS strengthens the security, reliability, and efficiency of the Cardano DeFi ecosystem.



Some of the benefits it provides:



**Improved Protocol Safety**

By ensuring fast and accurate liquidations, LaaS reduces the risk of bad debt and insolvency, protecting users’ funds and enhancing trust in Cardano-based DeFi platforms.



**Capital Efficiency**

Liquidity providers can participate once and earn liquidation incentives across multiple protocols, maximizing capital utilization and incentivizing broader liquidity participation on Cardano.



**Ecosystem Standardization**

LaaS provides a unified liquidation solution, reducing fragmentation and enabling new projects to integrate quickly without building custom liquidation engines. This fosters faster innovation and onboarding of new protocols.



**Enhanced User Experience**

By automating liquidations, LaaS reduces delays and operational failures, providing a smoother, more predictable experience for users interacting with Cardano DeFi platforms.



**Community Growth and Adoption**

A reliable liquidation infrastructure encourages more developers to build on Cardano, driving adoption, increasing TVL, and expanding the overall DeFi ecosystem.

sub_fields.title: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.description: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.answer:
Our team has extensive experience in blockchain and DeFi development, including smart contract engineering, protocol integration, and risk management. We are familiar with Cardano’s Plutus smart contracts (using Aiken), decentralized finance best practices, and security standards. This ensures that Liquidation Market (LaaS) will be implemented with robust, secure, and efficient architecture.



We will maintain high levels of trust and accountability through:



Open-source components: Key contracts and monitoring logic will be auditable by the community.



Transparent on-chain operations: All liquidations, collateral tracking, and reward distributions are executed on-chain and can be independently verified.



Regular audits: We will engage external security firms to review smart contracts and system integrations before deployment.



Governance and reporting: Protocol parameters, fees, and liquidator incentives will be transparent, with clear reporting on performance metrics.



Validation of the App

LaaS will be validated through:



Testnet deployment: Simulating liquidations on realistic test scenarios with multiple protocols and varying market conditions.



On-chain metrics tracking: Measuring liquidation execution speed, collateral recovered, and LP rewards to ensure effectiveness.



Community beta testing: Partnering with early Cardano DeFi protocols to test real-world integration before mainnet rollout.

sub_fields.title: Please provide a cost breakdown of the proposed work and resources
sub_fields.description: Please provide a cost breakdown of the proposed work and resources
sub_fields.answer:
The total budget for the Liquidation Market (LaaS) project is 60,000 ADA, allocated across four key milestones.



Milestone 1: Development and Internal Testing is allocated 20,000 ADA to cover the development of the core liquidation engine, including adapter contracts, liquidator logic, reward distribution systems, and monitoring modules, as well as comprehensive unit testing and simulation of liquidations across multiple DeFi scenarios.



Milestone 2: Testnet Deployment and Validation is allocated 15,000 ADA to support deployment on the Cardano testnet, integration with early partner protocols, tracking and validating on-chain metrics for liquidation performance and LP rewards, performance optimization, and resolution of any issues identified during testing.



Milestone 3: Mainnet Launch and Ecosystem Integration receives 25,000 ADA for the deployment of fully audited contracts on the Cardano mainnet, activation of liquidity pools, execution of live liquidations, integration with additional DeFi protocols, and preparation of transparency reports.



Milestone 4: Project Close-out Report and Video does not require additional funding, as it involves preparing a detailed final project report and a 2–3 minute video demonstrating the system’s functionality.



The budget also covers all necessary resources, including smart contract developers, back-end engineers for monitoring and liquidator bots, front-end developers for dashboards, external audits, testnet infrastructure costs, and documentation and reporting.

sub_fields.title: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.description: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.answer:
The total budget of 60,000 ADA represents strong value for money for the Cardano ecosystem because it supports the development of a shared infrastructure service that benefits multiple DeFi protocols rather than a single platform. By investing in LaaS, Cardano gains a reliable, standardized, and automated liquidation engine that enhances protocol security, reduces the risk of bad debt, and increases trust in the ecosystem.



The allocation is focused on core development, rigorous testing, secure mainnet deployment, and audit processes, ensuring that funds are spent on delivering a high-quality, robust system. By providing liquidity providers with the ability to earn rewards across multiple protocols, the project maximizes capital efficiency and ecosystem participation without requiring duplication of infrastructure.



Additionally, the project includes transparent reporting, dashboards, and a demonstration video to provide measurable evidence of outcomes, making the spending auditable and accountable. For the Cardano community, this investment translates into safer, more efficient DeFi protocols, greater adoption, and a foundation for future innovations, delivering lasting ecosystem value that extends well beyond the initial expenditure.
